net.canarymod.permissionsystem

Interface PermissionProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultiworldPermissionProvider

    public interface PermissionProvider
    Manages and provides permissions. Handles permission queries. The implementing class can and should be instantiated per group and if player has custom permissions set also for that player.
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter)

    • Method Summary

      Put all child nodes and childs of childs etc into one arrayList

      java.util.List<PermissionNode> getPermissionMap()

      • addPermission

        void addPermission(java.lang.String path,
                   boolean value,
                   int id)
        Add a new permission to the list. This is intelligent and will auto-sort the permission into the tree. If you don't have the permission ID, do not use this!
        Parameters:
        path -
        value -
        id -

      • addPermission

        void addPermission(java.lang.String path,
                   boolean value)
        This adds a new permission into this provider, also creating a new entry in the database. If the provided permission already exists in the DB, it's being updated. If the path already exists within this provider, it will be updated if required
        Parameters:
        path -
        value -

      • queryPermission

        boolean queryPermission(java.lang.String permission)
        Execute a query for the given permission path. If the query finds an asterisk permission on its way to the final node, it will exit prematurely with what the asterisk permission value is
        Parameters:
        permission -
        Returns:
        boolean value at that path

      • pathExists

        boolean pathExists(java.lang.String permission)

        void flushCache()
        Clears the permission cache

        void reload()
        Reload the permissions

        java.util.List<PermissionNode> getPermissionMap()
        Get the List of permission root nodes this provider is handling
        Returns:

      • getPermissionsAsStringList

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPermissionsAsStringList()
        Returns a List of Strings with the full permission node paths contained in this provider. Mostly used for storing this into a database
        Returns:

      • printPermissionsToCaller

        void printPermissionsToCaller(MessageReceiver caller)
        Print out the list of the permissions filed in this provider in a human readable way to the given caller
        Parameters:
        caller -

      • getWorld

        java.lang.String getWorld()
        get the world name for this permission provider. This is null if the permission provider is global (valid in all worlds)
        Returns:

      • getParent

        PermissionProvider getParent()
        Returns the parent permission provider. usually this is the global provider. Returns null if this PermissionProvider instance has no parent. Default CanaryMod logic mandates that only world-specific providers may have a parent - a global provider.
        Returns:
